definition: full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
fleabane (family Asteraceae)/disheveled/classifier for luxuriant plants, smoke, ashes, campfires: clump, puff

sentences.english: On every front there are young people abounding in vigor and vitality.
sentences.chinese: 在各條戰線上都有精力充沛朝氣蓬勃的青年人。

sentences.english: Run out and get several copies of this high-spirited school story.
sentences.chinese: 看完並仿效幾次這個朝氣蓬勃的校園故事吧。
第二，技術仍然朝氣蓬勃。

sentences.english: We have 87 qualified and hard-working teaching staff.
sentences.chinese: 學院師資隊伍朝氣蓬勃，現有專兼職教師87人。

sentences.english: A running teenage rolling an iron hoop, symbolizes the vigorous Zhangjiang.
sentences.chinese: 一個滾動鐵圈的奔跑少年，象徵着朝氣蓬勃的張江。

sentences.english: Rooters are all beautiful girls full of vigour and vitality.
sentences.chinese: 拉拉隊裏面都是漂亮的小姑娘，個個都朝氣蓬勃的。

sentences.english: A young but flourishing literature of the Iranian Diaspora has finally taken hold.
sentences.chinese: 年輕而朝氣蓬勃的海外伊朗人文學終於形成了。

sentences.english: It is in the flush of spring, and innumerable wild or game birds are seen feathering their nests.
sentences.chinese: 萬物朝氣蓬勃的春天，無數的野鳥或獵鳥在築巢。

definition: spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
